body.p: The disclosures about the characteristics of defined benefit plans and the amounts in the financial statements arising from defined benefit plans are based on those in IAS 19 before the amendments made in 2011 with the following changes:

li.p: additional information about exposure to risk (paragraphs BC216–BC218);
distinguishing between actuarial gains and losses arising from demographic and financial assumptions (paragraph BC219);
not requiring an entity to distinguish between plan amendments, curtailments and settlements if they occur together (paragraph BC220);
stating a principle for the disaggregation of plan assets rather than listing the categories required (paragraphs BC221–BC226); and
stating a principle for the disclosure of significant actuarial assumptions rather than listing the assumptions required to be disclosed (paragraphs BC227 and BC228).
